Articles.Content:
KSP freezing after 5 seconds of loading to the main menu

i have no mods,

i'm on 1.10.1

ksp.txt:

http://www.mediafire.com/file/pmmg6ps6d0hz7wu/file

i cant find my player.txt though

1 hour ago, Hadron27 said:

i cant find my player.txt though

because since the game crashed while loading the assets,and not loading the Gameplay assets,like the rockets,vab,buildings,etc,the app didn't created the Player.log.duh

______________________________________________________________________________________Solution Border,duh_________________

Apparently in you KSP.Log,i found a TLA_Stack_Debug_leak: 

[WRN 11:07:54.384] Internal: JobTempAlloc has allocations that are more than 4 frames old - this is not allowed and likely a leak
[WRN 11:07:54.384] To Debug, enable the define: TLA_DEBUG_STACK_LEAK in ThreadsafeLinearAllocator.cpp. This will output the callstacks of the leaked allocations
[WRN 11:07:54.399] Internal: JobTempAlloc has allocations that are more than 4 frames old - this is not allowed and likely a leak
[WRN 11:07:54.399] To Debug, enable the define: TLA_DEBUG_STACK_LEAK in ThreadsafeLinearAllocator.cpp. This will output the callstacks of the leaked allocations
[WRN 11:07:58.837] Internal: JobTempAlloc has allocations that are more than 4 frames old - this is not allowed and likely a leak
[WRN 11:07:58.837] To Debug, enable the define: TLA_DEBUG_STACK_LEAK in ThreadsafeLinearAllocator.cpp. This will output the callstacks of the leaked allocations

Luckily,i found a Solution for this.

however,It's not a fix, it's a workaround to keep you playing - but it worths the try: On the Main Menu, Settings, Graphics, Set the Frame Rate Limit to 60 fps.

The hard part on all of this is to try to replicate the problem here on my machine - once I manage to do that, I will have something to sniff on.

basically,that's what @Lisias said to Commodore_32 in this topic:

which he also had that TLA problem.

and another solution(in case changing the fps limits still doesn't work,or if you want to lower the posibility to get yelled by the tla) is changing the V-sync to Don't V-sync,which it's probably the best option to increase FPS,aka,lowering the possibilities to get a TLA_DEBUG_STACK_LEAK.

Edited September 15, 2020 by Kane Kerman
tyops!

By the way, Can we be friends?

Wait, what? Theres no way that could've crashed me. I didnt even try and load the save. By the way, I downloaded some craft file things a while back from one of those real rocketry mods and their save thingies wont go away even though their craft files dont even exist anymore

2 hours ago, Kane Kerman said:

no problem!

can you help me i cant delete the Bluedog Design Bureau craft files they're not deleting when i fully remove the files

1 minute ago, Hadron27 said:

can you help me i cant delete the Bluedog Design Bureau craft files they're not deleting when i fully remove the files

ok.

there's 2 solutions:

1:Through KSP: start ksp and then go to your save file,and then play it,then go to the VAB building,click the saved ships,and delete all the crafts one by one.

2:Manual Deletion: go to the ksp Root Folder,aka,the ksp game folder ex:C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\Ships\VAB and then, delete all the files like Loadmeta and Craft.

i think that should help(?)

2 hours ago, Hadron27 said:

i looked further into the craft files and uhhhhh

i have 243 files in my VAB folder for crafts

 

also i hate how the exact same thing happened to another dude but he had mods and i have stock

Well, it could be argued that by downloading those craft files from that mod, you are no longer stock....

http://www.mediafire.com/file/ftxfvkycglzexds/file

Through KSP: They cannot be deleted, just like the "Stock" crafts that come with the game.

Manual deletion: They come back/They still show up in the "Load craft" section.

It seems TLA_DEBUG_STACK_LEAK strikes again.

Edited September 16, 2020 by Hadron27
whoops

Try this:

  • Go into saves folder, pick any save(s) you want to keep and copy the persistent.sfs files ONLY to an outside location, like your desktop.
  • Turn off steam cloud sync- right click KSP, click Properties, click the Updates tab then disable cloud synchronisation. Save the changes.
  • Completely uninstall KSP, delete any leftover files.
  • Reinstall KSP and make sure the ships/VAB and ships/SPH folders have only stock crafts in them- there should be 10-15 of each.
  • Create a new save game, then copy the folder, rename it to the same name as your existing save and replace the persistent.sfs file with the file you saved on the desktop; repeat for all the saves you want to keep.
